reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Integrated Emergency WASH Response to IDPs in camps and informal settlements in Azaz

description.narrative: Maram Foundation seeks to save lives, uphold rights, and promote access to key institutions and services through providing WASH services in particular. So, MF in Turkey office is remotely managing the delivery of integrated WASH assistance with main-streamed protection and advocacy in Azaz (Aleppo). Timely humanitarian relief and enhanced protection to vulnerable is delivered to those affected by emergency situations in the settlements. Basic WASH assistance is delivered to the targeted community by taking into account the different needs of men, women, boys, and girls, in addition, to take into consideration the special needs of disabled people in all the project activities, especially during the infrastructure designs. So, Maram applied for the SCHF 1st standard allocation to provide 24,035 IDPs, 4741 households (HHs) living in Northern camps in Aleppo governorate with basic WASH services including drinking water, solid waste removal, de-sludging latrine septic tanks, cleaning the latrines, rehabilitation of latrines, garbage bins distribution, an extension of the water network, in addition, to rehabilitation the sanitation network in Tal Jubeen camp. The proposed project is a continuation of the current project implementing by Maram in Bab Al Noor and Elbil camps (targeting with full WASH services) in addition to target a new two camps Al Sadaka, and Tal Jubeen in Aleppo- Azaz district, the targeted locations are in two subdistricts (Azaz and Suran) and two communities (Albil and Shamarien). The project design was done according to SPHERE standards and WASH guidance in line with current SCHF allocation priorities where all the proposed activities in this project are according to the need assessment which was conducted by Maram in May 2020 and in coordinating with WASH cluster and several NGOs. The planned intervention will mainstream protection principles especially (Do no harm) throughout the project cycle by considering the different needs of men, women, young children, children, adolescents, young adults, middle-aged adults, and older adults. The provision of sanitation services (latrines, washing facilities, etc.), will be consulted with the targeted camps and communities, and take into account the specific needs of each group. So, as a summary of the project activities and implementing plan, Maram will implement the following activities: - In Bab Al Noor, Elbil and Al Sadaka camps: Full WASH services including water supply, garbage collection, garbage bins, extension of water network, desludging septic tanks, cleaning latrines, rehabilitation of latrines, and hygiene kits distribution, in addition to providing all the required maintenance for water or sanitation networks, in addition to providing the water supplying in Elbil village. - In Tal Jubeen camp: Maram will rehabilitate the sanitation network to connecting it to the main sewage line. Implementation plan: - Maram will hold coordination meetings with the targeted camps management to explain Maram's WASH intervention, update the needs and IDPs numbers. - Regarding the daily activities (water supply, garbage collection...etc.) all PRs will be prepared after signing the agreement and before starting the project in order to start providing the services at the beginning of the project period, which means all the important and urgent activities will start at the first of the project with 12 months period - While for the technical studies (the water network, rehab sanitation network...etc) all the tenders will be prepared after starting the project according to Maram's policy. - Furthermore, during the project life, monitoring will be conducted at every stage of the project duration by collecting routine data and analysis on a continuous basis, in addition to evaluating the services provided by Maram to evaluate the service and find out how it met the needs of beneficiaries of different ages.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
